name: Franconia Falls

trails_config.name: Franconia Falls via Lincoln Woods
trails_config.description: A wilderness-style walk to wide granite cascades and pools—one of the best swimming-hole waterfall hikes in the Whites. Plan for a longer day and bring bug spray in summer; early starts help with parking.
trails_config.parking_info: Lincoln Woods Trailhead Parking, Kancamagus Hwy (NH-112), Lincoln

trails_config.name: Franconia Falls + Black Pond Loop
trails_config.description: Add variety by looping past Black Pond for a quieter forest-and-water combo, then finish at the cascades for a dip. This is a great shoulder-season hike when the river is lively but crowds are lighter.
trails_config.parking_info: Lincoln Woods Trailhead Parking, Kancamagus Hwy (NH-112), Lincoln

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Franconia Falls rises to 1555 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 1555 feet, Franconia Falls is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Franconia Falls via Lincoln Woods**, a **6.5 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Bondcliff**, which is just 2.0 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
